title: Digital and print advertising revenue of U.S. newspapers 2003 to 2014
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Print, and Digital. The y axis indicates the Revenue in billion U.S. dollars and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Print is gradually decreasing, Digital is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Print, and lastly, 2. Digital.
Throughout the period, Print generally had the highest Revenue in billion U.S. dollars relative to others with an average of 31.96, and it reached its maximum at 2005 with a value of 47.41.
The botommost line, Digital,  has a mean of 2.75, and peaked at 2014.

Overall Print is gradually decreasing, Digital is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Print, and lastly, 2. Digital.

The minimum Revenue in billion U.S. dollars about 1.22, occured at 2003 by Digital.
The difference of Revenue in billion U.S. dollars between Print and Digital is smaller at Year 2014 compared to the Year 2003.
